intro: Cryptantha patula, commonly known as the slender phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Cryptantha patula is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting pollinators.
